artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: partially kneeling man in foreground with bare legs, PL hand behind his back hidden by hem of his short grey and blue striped kimono with light blue trim and lining; five men wearing black threatening kneeling man with short blue sticks; interior scene with yellow chest in middle ground at center
markings: Artist’s seal: 魁斎 {Kaisai} | Censor seal: 申五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Actor Kataoka Nizaemon VIII as Amakawaya Gihei. Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Tenth Act
